summary: I am a Software Engineer based in the Netherlands, currently working as a Machine Learning Engineer at ZenML. I am the co-creator of Ekko, a self-deployable realtime infrastructure library with in-transit message processing. I have multiple years of experience in the Python, Ruby and JavaScript ecosystems and am comfortable working with Go, PostgreSQL, Terraform, cloud infrastructure and Docker. I have a PhD in History and authored several books based on my research work in Afghanistan.

treasury_media.title: Training a classifier to detect redacted documents with fastai
treasury_media.description: Explanation of how I trained a model to detect redactions in FOIA requests.

treasury_media.title: Ekko
treasury_media.description: Ekko is an open-source framework allowing developers to easily add realtime infrastructure and in-transit message processing to web applications. Use our command-line tool to spin up realtime infrastructure on AWS and deploy serverless functions to process your messages as they pass through the realtime system. Custom serverless functions deployed on Ekko offer flexibility and modularity for your realtime needs.

awards.title: Sir Michael Howard Excellence Award
awards.description:
Alex Strick van Linschoten and Felix Kuehn have been awarded the Sir Michael Howard Excellence Award, for their book, An Enemy We Created: The Myth of the Taliban/Al Qaeda Merger in Afghanistan, 1970-2010 (Hurst and Oxford University Press, 2012). 

Alex and Felix are both PhD students in the Department of War Studies and are at the forefront of developing our understanding of the Taliban movement. They translated and edited Mullah Zaeff’s memoir, published as Abdul Salam Zaeff, My Life in the Taliban  (Hurst and Oxford University Press, 2010), and currently are developing an archive of Taliban documents which will be placed online for researchers the world over to use. More information can be found at www.anenemywecreated.com
Professor Theo Farrell, Head of War Studies commented, 

"This is a strikingly original book, that gives us remarkable insight into Al Qaeda and the Taliban, and convincingly challenges the dominant policy view that the two organisations were joined at the hip. It represents the very best scholarship by doctoral researchers in War Studies. We are immensely grateful to Dr. John Hillen for his generous gift which made it possible for us to recognise this remarkable." 

The Sir Michael Howard Excellence Award comprises a gift of $8,000 funded by the Honorable Dr. John Hillen and is awarded for an outstanding piece of academic research by a current postgraduate candidate. The Prize Committee comprised Professor Theo Farrell (Chair), Professor Joe Maiolo Professor Guglielmo Verdirame and Dr. Reinould Leenders

profile_positions.description:
- Project manager for a squad developing platform and open-source features
- Developed and deployed company's LLM-based Slack support bot for OSS community
- Implemented core abstractions for 2 core ML components (data annotation & feature stores) along with a role in many other features
- Led implementation of mlstacks, our Terraform-based MLOps stack deployment tool
- Designed and hosted on an MLOps competition with 250+ participants
profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Engineer

profile_positions.description: A project that seeks to preserve primary source texts and commission new books from up-and-coming authors. We work extensively with authors writing in Arabic, Dari and Pashto from the Middle East and further afield.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: Sources & Methods is a podcast I host together with Matt Trevithick in which interesting people doing interesting things get to talk about the what, how and why of what they do. sourcesandmethods.com
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Co-Host

profile_positions.description:
- Co-created Ekko, an open-source framework allowing developers to easily add realtime infrastructure and in-transit message processing to web applications
- Prototyped and built WebSocket server using Node.js, Socket.IO, and Redis
- Designed the cloud infrastructure needed to support tens of thousands of concurrent WebSocket connections and serverless Lambda invocations for messages (Application Load Balancer (ALB), ECS Fargate, S3, ElastiCache, Lambda, IAM policies/roles and VPCs)
- Containerised the server code for deployment to AWS cloud infrastructure (Docker, ECR, ECS)
- Automated infrastructure deployment using AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) code, CloudFormation templates and SDK
- Worked on CLI tool for project setup, AWS credential configuration, infrastructure deployment, teardown, and Lambda management (oclif / JavaScript)
- Load tested the real-time service using artillery.io to simulate 50,000 concurrent connections
- Collaborated daily with a small team of fully remote engineers spread over 14 timezones
- Wrote a comprehensive technical case study documenting design decisions (https://ekko-realtime.com) along with repository and code documentation
profile_positions.title: Co-Creator, Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Coachbot, an open-source application to support independent study for language learning (first Flask / Python, then Ruby / Sinatra, hosted on Heroku)
- ‘Ello, a kanban board application inspired by Trello (React / Redux, Express and MongoDB)
- RequestBin, a database-backed application for receiving and debugging webhooks (NodeJS, PostgreSQL, Socket.IO, cron jobs)
- Tasky, a personal task management app (Ruby/Sinatra, PostgreSQL and Handlebars.js)

profile_positions.description:
- Field investigation and research work across the Middle East and Afghanistan for legal defence cases; extensive experience working in teams (sized from 2 up to 30)

profile_positions.title: Researcher / author / consultant

profile_positions.description: Led a major initiative to index, digitise, translate, and distribute a landmark collection of Taliban documents estimated to contain more than 2 million words of text. The TSP collection is one of only a few such private document archives in existence, and is the only collection to amass documentary evidence of Taliban cultural, social and legal output for the years 1979-2014.
profile_positions.title: TSP Project
